alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 3:31AM EST until January 12 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EST/530 AM CST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana and NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following areas, in south central Indiana, Harrison. In NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Breckinridge, Bullitt, Hardin, Jefferson and Meade. * WHEN...Until 630 AM EST /530 AM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 AM EST /231 AM CST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Louisville, Shively, Brandenburg, Hollyvilla, South Park View, Valley Station, Pleasure Ridge Park, Pleasure Ridge Par, St. Dennis and Fairdale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
